thread.title: Girls tennis: MKA's Calandra reaches Prep singles flight final
thread.title_full: Girls tennis: MKA's Calandra reaches Prep singles flight final

title: Girls tennis: MKA's Calandra reaches Prep singles flight final
text:
Girls tennis: MKA's Calandra reaches Prep singles flight final October 22, 2015 Last updated: Thursday, October 22, 2015, 12:32 AM The Montclair Times Print 
Montclair Kimberley Academy senior Bella Calandra will play for the No. 3 singles flight title at the Prep B Championships today, Thursday, Oct. 22, at Edison’s Garden State Tennis Center. 
Calandra (13-7 record this season), the top seed in the 10-player third singles field, won two matches in Sunday’s preliminary rounds to reach today’s final against Ranney Prep’s Emma Nisbet. 
The Cougar standout and four-year starter defeated Grace Kellogg of Morristown-Beard, 6-4, 6-3, in the quarterfinals, then topped Golda Och’s Corinna Ronen, 6-2, 6-3, in the semifinals. 
On Monday, MKA (9-9 overall) won its first SEC-American Division match of the season, edging Glen Ridge by a 3-2 count. 
Calandra (third singles) and the team of Joelle Crichlow and Gianna Balonze (second doubles) each won in straight sets, while No. 2 singles Hallie Ryan won the decisive point in a tight three-setter, 3-6, 6-0, 6-4, over Jane Kay. 
MKA closes out the 2015 season Friday at home against Verona.
